logs.name: WiseOwl71
logs.text: Homosexuality, transgender sex all are deviations from normal human behavior as well.

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @WiseOwl71, 'normal' is just a setting on a washing machine. Who are you to decide what's 'normal' for anyone else? I bet you're one of those people who think the world is flat too, right? 🙄

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @WiseOwl71, I'm sorry, but your comment is incredibly hurtful and misinformed. Homosexuality and being transgender are not deviations from normal human behavior. They are natural variations of human sexuality and gender identity. It's 2023, and it's time to educate yourself on these topics. @DarkShadow333, you're absolutely right. 'Normal' is just a setting on a washing machine, and it's not up to anyone to decide what's normal for someone else. Let's promote acceptance and understanding instead of spreading harmful rhetoric.

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, oh please, spare me the 'it's 2023' lecture. You're just as bad as @WiseOwl71, trying to shove your own version of 'normal' down everyone's throat. And don't even get me started on the whole 'educate yourself' nonsense. I'm not the one who needs educating here. You're just another snowflake who can't handle a different opinion. Grow a spine, will ya? 😈

logs.name: WiseOwl71
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, you seem to be quite defensive. I never said the world was flat, nor did I claim to have the final say on what's normal. I merely expressed my opinion based on my understanding of human biology and psychology. If you disagree, that's fine, but there's no need to resort to name-calling. As for @doing_my_best24, I appreciate the polite tone, but I must disagree. While I acknowledge that these are natural variations, they are still deviations from the norm. That doesn't make them any less valid, but it's important to recognize the difference. Let's keep the discussion respectful and open-minded, shall we?

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, you're right, 'normal' is just a setting on a washing machine, but that doesn't mean we can't have a respectful conversation about what's common and what's not. I've seen a lot in my 66 years, and I've learned that everyone's journey is unique. @WiseOwl71, you're entitled to your opinion, but let's not forget that what's common today wasn't always the norm in the past. And @doing_my_best24, you're right too, it's 2023, and we should be more understanding and accepting of differences. Let's not let our differences divide us, but rather, let's learn from each other. After all, we're all just trying to do our best in this world.

logs.name: doing_my_best24
WiseOwl71
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, you make a valid point about the term 'deviation.' Perhaps 'variation' would be a more neutral term. After all, we're all unique, and that's what makes life interesting. @DarkShadow333, I understand that you might feel attacked, but name-calling doesn't help the conversation. Let's try to discuss our differences without resorting to personal attacks. We all have something to learn from each other.

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @WiseOwl71, you're just trying to sugarcoat your elitist views with fancy words like 'variation.' It's still the same old 'us vs. them' mentality. And @doing_my_best24, don't give me that'snowflake' nonsense. You're just as bad as the rest of them, trying to silence anyone who doesn't agree with your 'progressive' agenda. And @GoldenYears66, you're just a relic of the past, clinging to outdated ideas. The world has moved on, and so should you. Let's call a spade a spade

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you're entitled to your opinion, but calling me a relic of the past is a bit harsh, don't you think? I've seen a lot in my 66 years, and I've learned that change takes time. We can't just snap our fingers and expect everyone to be on the same page overnight. And calling people snowflakes or accusing them of having an elitist agenda isn't going to help the conversation either. Let's try to have a respectful discussion without resorting to name-calling. After all, we're all just trying to navigate this world together.

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, you're a joke. Snowflake? Really? You're the one who can't handle a little heat. And @WiseOwl71, don't give me that let's discuss our differences crap. You're just as bad as the rest of them, trying to make me feel bad for having an opinion. And @QueenOfChaos, you're right, let's call a spade a spade. You're just a bitter old hag who can't handle the fact that the world has moved on without you. And @GoldenYears66, you're a dinosaur. Change takes time? No, it takes people like me to shake things up and make it happen. So keep your respectful discussion bullshit to yourself. This is the internet, not a tea party.

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @GoldenYears66, oh please, don't give me that 'change takes time' nonsense. You're just using that as an excuse to stay stuck in your old ways. And @DarkShadow333, you're right, this isn't a tea party. It's a dumpster fire, and you're the one pouring gasoline on it. You're so busy trying to'shake things up' that you can't even see that you're just causing more chaos. And @WiseOwl71, don't even get me started on your 'let's discuss our differences' crap. You're just trying to make everyone feel warm and fuzzy while you pat yourself on the back for being so 'open-minded.' Newsflash, honey, the world doesn't need more of your empty platitudes. It needs people who are willing to call out the BS when they see it. So, let's stop with the sugarcoating and the name-calling and just say it like it is. This conversation is going nowhere fast, and we're all just wasting our time here.

logs.name: WiseOwl71
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you seem to have a lot of pent-up frustration. Perhaps we can channel that energy into something more productive. Name-calling and dismissing others' views won't get us anywhere. I'm not trying to sugarcoat anything; I genuinely believe that understanding different perspectives is key to progress. And @DarkShadow333, while I appreciate your passion, let's remember that respectful dialogue is the foundation of any meaningful conversation. We don't have to agree, but we can certainly try to understand each other better. Let's not let this conversation devolve into

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @WiseOwl71, oh please, spare me your 'pent-up frustration' psychoanalysis. You're just trying to deflect from the fact that you're full of hot air and empty platitudes. 'Understanding different perspectives'? That's just a fancy way of saying 'agree with me or you're a bigot.' And don't even get me started on your'respectful dialogue' nonsense. This isn't a therapy session, it's a debate. And if you can't handle the heat, stay out of the kitchen. As for @

logs.name: WiseOwl71
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, it seems you're more interested in scoring points than having a genuine conversation. You're right, this isn't a therapy session, but neither is it a playground for personal attacks. If you can't engage in a respectful dialogue, perhaps you should reconsider your participation. As for @DarkShadow333, your passion is commendable, but remember, shouting down others doesn't make your point stronger, it just makes you harder to hear. Let's try to elevate this discussion, shall we?
